data.title: Trim trailing whitespace on save
data.body:
Added an option to trim trailing whitespace on save.
closes #4383

data.title: No code completion when inheriting a custom class that inherits a builtin class
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Arch Linux (Godot version 2.0.1)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If you create a GDScript file, then inherit a builtin class, upon inheriting the file you will not get code completion for the builtin class.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a file called `myclass.gd`
- Put only `extends Sprite` in the file
- Create another file called `test.gd`
- Put `extends "res://myclass.gd"` in the file
- In both files, write some function definition (e.g. `func test():`)
- In an indented block on the next line, try to write letters that some of the functions in `Sprite` start with, like `get` or `set`
- You will not see completion for them in `test.gd`, but you will in `myclass.gd`

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Download](https://ptpb.pw/vwHs.zip)

data.title: Make a better panel for the tilemap editor (zoom, columns alignment)
data.body:
Currrently, when the tilemap editor's tiles panel is resized it looks quite strange.... (all columns are displaced)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14762895/9dc1dbfe-098e-11e6-9820-7f77da56df23.png)

And here is how it looks with very smallish tiles: (Good luck finding and clicking the right one!)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14762930/69346f90-098f-11e6-9bf1-46f1ce760425.png)

The problems:
- Columns are misaligned
- Small tiles are basically invisible

---

We discussed with @akien-mga on IRC (in an non-godotengine channel), a few fixes for those two scenarios:
1. Make everything properly aligned in nice columns somehow. (Will PR soon)
2. Add a zoom option. ( Done in #4800 )
3. Add an option to hide the names of tiles, since they are useless (take too much space) in some cases (like in the first pic).

---

To future responders: Note that this issue is not a place to dump your latest tilemap editor idea -- you should preferably open a new issue for that. This issue is specifically for discussing the above two examples (along with similar examples), and solutions for the problems presented.

data.title: Save before Instance a scene file as a Node
data.body: Using "Instance a scene file as a Node" is not saving the selected scene(was recently updated an shows an \* on tab) so it adds an old state.

data.title: Play the project is only saving the current selected tab
data.body:
Play the project is only saving the current selected tab.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create two scenes(tabs)
2.Edit both to that the tabs show *
3.Press "Play the project" -> BUG: Now only the selected tab is beeing saved, the other tab still shows \* and the game is not showing the changes of the second(not saved) tab.

data.title: Encode axis_value in Variant for InputEvent::JOYSTICK_MOTION.
data.body:
Fixes a bug that caused InputMap actions which have been set to joystick axes
not to work correctly on exported builds as the `axis_value` property wouldn't be serialized into engine.cfb.
See recent discussion in #49 (Post 121+)

data.title: Imported BMFont not visible in HTML5 export
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 10 x64 Pro / Google Chrome

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I imported a BMFont bitmap font file as a Godot font. It is visible in Windows builds, but in a HTML5 export, the font is totally invisible.
The console displays the following error for every character:

```
[1;31mERROR: draw_char: [0m[1mCondition ' c->texture_idx<-1 || c->texture_idx>=textures.size() ' is true. returned: 0
[0;31m   At: scene/resources/font.cpp:492.[0m
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Import a BMFont file. Create a new scene and label using that font. Export as HTML5, run in Browser. The label text is invisible.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Test in browser: http://ray.syroot.com/fonttest
Source: http://ray.syroot.com/fonttest/source.zip

data.title: Fix continious update with Camera2D
data.body:
Closes #4406 

Seems like I forgot a simple way of getting into `fixed_process` callbacks still in the editor...

_Hint: `set_follow_smoothing` would trigger `set_fixed_process` while it is either out of the tree or not in the editor._

data.title: Editor continuously updating with Camera2D in scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Ubuntu 15.10 x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The editor is continuously being updated/redrawn if the scene contains a Camera2D. I am not sure, but this issue may be a regression from #4373

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Add Camera2D to a scene
- Close the scene and reopen it
- The editor will be updating/redrawing continuously (check the progress wheel in the top right corner) like when _Update Always_ is enabled

data.title: Error on compiling android by clang
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Linux 4.5.1-1-ARCH
ndk r11c

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I modified platform/android/detect.py script to support clang compiling (https://github.com/quabug/godot/commit/36937214ab42692cf4622f503b3156b88b696b7c), but it seems have some error during linking.

`/home/quabug/dev/sdk/android-ndk/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/bin/clang++ -o bin/libgodot.android.debug.armv7.so -g --sysroot=/home/quabug/dev/sdk/android-ndk/platforms/android-15/arch-arm -Wl,--no-undefined -Wl,-z,noexecstack -Wl,-soname,libgodot_android.so -shared platform/android/os_android.os platform/android/godot_android.os platform/android/file_access_android.os platform/android/dir_access_android.os platform/android/audio_driver_opensl.os platform/android/file_access_jandroid.os platform/android/dir_access_jandroid.os platform/android/thread_jandroid.os platform/android/audio_driver_jandroid.os platform/android/ifaddrs_android.os platform/android/android_native_app_glue.os platform/android/java_glue.os platform/android/cpu-features.os platform/android/java_class_wrapper.os -L/home/quabug/dev/sdk/android-ndk/sources/cxx-stl/llvm-libc++/libs/armeabi-v7a main/libmain.android.debug.armv7.a modules/libmodules.android.debug.armv7.a bin/tests/libtests.android.debug.armv7.a drivers/libdrivers.android.debug.armv7.a scene/libscene.android.debug.armv7.a servers/libservers.android.debug.armv7.a core/libcore.android.debug.armv7.a -lOpenSLES -lEGL -lOpenSLES -landroid -lc -lm -lstdc++ -llog -lGLESv1_CM -lGLESv2 -lz -lstatic_c++`

`/..//bin/ld: cannot find crti.o: No such file or directory`
`/..//bin/ld: cannot find crtbeginS.o: No such file or directory`
`/..//bin/ld: platform/android/os_android.os: Relocations in generic ELF (EM: 40)`
`platform/android/os_android.os: error adding symbols: File in wrong format`
`clang++: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)`

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. modify detect.py script. And also need to disable webp and neon.
2. run `scons p=android`

data.title: Can't input double quotes (< " > character) on Mac OS X with US International keyboard layout
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
MacOS X Mavericks

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Can't use simple or double quotes inside the godot script editor using US-International keyboard layout.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open any godot version since 2.0 stable
- Attach a Panel to you Scene
- Create a Script attached to the given panel

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
You can use my project as example:
https://github.com/emanuelcds/SlotMockRuntime

(I need to edit the gdscript files on VIM to edit the game logic and resync it on the engine).

data.title: Add a python script to check the current doc status
data.body:
As requested by @akien-mga 
Here are some screens:

Direct invocation
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14746725/9e3c9afe-08b9-11e6-912c-5f91ad5dbf2b.png)

Adding `doc/base/classes.xml`
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14746751/c0b9f018-08b9-11e6-92fe-53aa89961415.png)

Using narrow screen mode (`--collapse`/`--narrow`)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14746774/e288ea6e-08b9-11e6-9e93-5ed0ddf0bd77.png)

Using percentages (`--percent`)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14746882/71e9f6da-08ba-11e6-9a53-f5ccd7b69d9e.png)

Filtering to just a handful classes, and generating docs urls
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/14746970/ba719066-08ba-11e6-99a2-e5bb88e23dfc.png)

Note that all flags available are toggles, which means that using `--help --help` would result in no help at all. (Same goes for `--collapse --colors --collapse`, etc.)

data.title: add sign comparison for joystick axis events in InputMap::_find_event
data.body: fixes #4400

data.title: InputEvent.is_action() not working correctly with Joystick axis events
data.body:
**Issue description**:
`event.is_action{_pressed;_released}()` doesn't work for joystick axes when there are
actions defined for both the posivite and negative direction of an axis (only one of them can be triggered).

It happens because `InputMap::_find_event()` only compares the axis number of `InputEvent::JOYSTICK_MOTION` events, disregarding their direction.

**Link to minimal example project**:
Move the left stick on a gamepad, only "left" and "down" will be printed.
[ev_is_action_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/231966/ev_is_action_bug.zip)

data.title: [TRACKER] Issues with inner classes in GDScript
data.body:
Listing of issues (and if relevant, PRs) relative to inner classes in GDScript:
- [x] #1110 Can't derive constants from other constants in inner classes
- [x] #1411 const of base class not accessible
- [ ] #3387 Initialization bugs in inner classes with several (2) levels of inheritance
- [x] #3766 Can't debug inner classes with breakpoints
- [x] #4026 extends on Subclass doesn't resolve relative Paths to GDScript
- [ ] #4472 A Inner class can not access its outer class's functions
- [x] #4756 Instancing inner classes directly from 'preload()' gives errors in editor, but works.

Feel free to edit/comment to add other relevant issues.

data.title: List of obsolete methods to deprecate
data.body:
We have quite a few obsolete and/or empty methods that should be deprecated, as they can be quite misleading for the users (see e.g. [this question about `OS.get_fullscreen_mode_list()`](http://godotengine.org/qa/3150/full-screen-list-generation)). Especially `OS` seems to have a good share of obsolete methods, that when asked about @reduz says "Don't use it, it's obsolete, use <foo> instead".

So this issue is meant to list and discuss such methods, to see which ones we should deprecate (and which ones should _not_ be deprecated but maybe improved/fixed). Once #4397 is solved, we should have a simple way to efficiently deprecate methods.

data.title: Macro to use when deprecating methods
data.body:
It would be nice to have a C++ macro that could be used when deprecating methods. It should:
- Display a user-defined warning in the terminal
- Optionally, run the method that replaces the deprecated method if compatible (e.g. if the method was just renamed, the old name could be deprecated this way and redirect to the new name)

It could be something like:

```
void OS::foo(int p_bar) {
    WARN_DEPRECATED("This method has been deprecated, redirecting to the equivalent OS.bar(bar)", OS::bar(p_bar));
}
```

Or maybe better, assuming that we'll mostly want to deprecate bindings and not directly C++ APIs (those APIs should be transparent to the end users), we could have a `ObjectTypeDB::bind_method_deprecated` method to replace `ObjectTypeDB::bind_method` where relevant. For the above example, it could be something like:

```
ObjectTypeDB::bind_method_deprecated(_MD("foo", "bar"),"This method has been deprecated, redirecting to the equivalent OS.bar(bar)",&OS::bar);
```

WDYT?

data.title: sliders of Color Picker behave wrong in RAW mode
data.body:
there is a button named `raw mode` in color picker,
when turned on, rgb become from 0 to 1 but not from 0 to 255.
bug1: the slider still has the range of 0~255. it should be 0~1 then
bug2: alpha is not affected, at least in preview, e.g. 128 is still half opaque

data.title: UDPPacketPeer .get_var() returning decode_variant error
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 64 bit
Godot 2.0.2 stable official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When trying to receive string data through UDP using udp.get_var() the console shows the following error:
ERROR: decode_variant: Condition ' type>=Variant::VARIANT_MAX ' is true. returned: ERR_INVALID_DATA
   At: core/io/marshalls.cpp:47
I noticed this problem on both the udp_chat demo and my own personal implementation.

**Steps to reproduce:**
run udp_chat demo and receive text packet from a remote host.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Not necessary, use udp_chat demo.

data.title: Text Editor discards unsaved changes when Godot gets focus again
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 10 Pro x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
A script has been modified in the editor, but not saved yet. I switch to another app and then back to Godot. The script gets reverted to the last saved version, and all my changes are lost!

**Steps to reproduce:**
I'm not sure how to trigger it. When working with Godot for a while, this starts to happen. Only one editor file seems to be affected. Closing the file and re-opening it fixes it. If I know more, I edit the issue. I simply focus another app, either by mouse or by keyboard (Alt+Tab), and when I go back to Godot, I shortly see the unsaved recent contents, and then them being immediately replaced by the last saved version.

data.title: CollisionShape2D trigger doesn't behave as expected
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
OSX  10.10.3
Godot 2.0.2 stable official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
One moving KinematicBody2D with a shape set as trigger doesn't collide with other KinematicBody2D. 
According to the documentation:

> A trigger shape detects collisions, but is otherwise unaffected by physics (i.e. will not block movement of colliding objects).

I expect to detect the collision in the script but the body wouldn't stop its movement. What happens is that  the is_colliding() doesn't return true when the two bodies overlaps and no collision is detected

**Steps to reproduce:**
See minimal example

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/genete/triggerbug

data.title: Setting emulate_touch_screen in project settings, results in editor simulating touch screen as well
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Ubuntu 15.10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
In project settings if you set `Display->emulate_touch_screen` to true, then Godot editor will emulate touch screen as well. As a result of this it's impossible to select multiple lines of text in Help window. 
![cantselectlines](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/14714548/b7ea1ad2-07e5-11e6-9393-9a444593b0a2.gif)
Probably there are also other side effects of this setting.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Go into `Scene->Project Settings`
2. `Display` section.
3. Check `emulate_touch_screen`
4. Restart Godot Editor
5. Open Godot help window
6. Try to select multiple lines

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Method to assess the extents of a tilemap (level size)
data.body:
There is, AFAIK, no easy way to determine the extents of a tilemap right now, i.e. the size of the Rect2 from the top-left tile to the bottom-right tile that would cover the whole non-null level area.

This would be quite useful for games that need e.g. to define margins for a Camera2D on levels with different sizes, without having to hardcode the size in each level script.

The output of the method could be:
- a Vector2 with number of tiles horizontally and vertically, e.g. `Vector2(12,18)`
- a Rect2 with the position of the topmost tile, and then the size as defined above, e.g. `Rect2(Vector2(-4,0),Vector2(12,18))`

Example:
![godot-tilemap-size](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/14703117/6fdca796-07ae-11e6-8080-baca58d14e29.png)

data.title: Cannot compile for platform WinRT
data.body:
Hello folks, I decided to try Godot for WinRT platform but i couldn't compile it. I know that WinRT is not officially supported, but anyway...

The first problem that i encountered what something related to Windows Store  and the fix was to comment [this line here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/winrt/detect.py#L51). 

After that it starts to compile the [gl_context_egl.h](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/winrt/gl_context_egl.h) files. Here i got an error that it cannot find the namespace `Windows::UI::Core` but that was fixed with a single line like:
`#include <windows.ui.core.h>`

Then it starts to build the core components. This is where i reached the deadend. The [Error enum](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/error_list.h) conflicts with some system class that is named `Error`. 

As a result i got [this huge error list](http://www.pasteall.org/68336).

I am using Windows 10 x64, Visual Studio 2015 Community edition. I was using the ARM Developer Command prompt, as [described in the wiki](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/reference/compiling_for_universal_windows_apps.html).

However there were no problems to build Godot for Windows platform.

Update:
This could be helpful for the future researches: 
[Supported Win32 APIs for Windows Phone 8](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/jj662956%28v=vs.105%29.aspx)

data.title: Adds a remove class item option in the theme editor.
data.body: I've also added a get_stylebox_types helper function to the theme class in order to figure out exactly what types are available to a theme.

data.title: Hooked up RigidBody2D torque methods
data.body:
Hooked up `set_applied_torque` and `get_applied_torque`, which existed in the physics server but weren't wrapped with `RigidBody2D` methods nor bound in GDScript.

Added a `get_inertia` method which returns the value, since they're probably much bigger than most people would expect. I didn't add a setter since the inertia appears to be automatically computed from the mass and the shapes. The inverse inertia is cached, so you _might_ be able to set it and it would stay until you changed a shape or the mass, but that's...probably not very useful, so I didn't add a setter function.

I also documented the read-only nature of `get_inertia` and added the obvious (probably redundant) minimal description of the other two methods.
